question: Which describes the cloud design principle of scalability?
answer: The ability to automatically increase available compute resources to meet growing user demand

question: Which describes the cloud service model known as infrastructure as a service (IaaS)?
answer: Customer rental of the use of measured units of a provider’s physical compute, storage, and networking resources

question: How does AWS ensure that no single customer consumes an unsustainable proportion of available resources?
answer: AWS imposes default limits on the use of its service resources but allows customers to request higher limits

question: The AWS Free Tier is designed to give new account holders the opportunity to get to know how their services work without necessarily costing any money. How does it work?
answer: You get free lightweight access to many core AWS services for a full 12 months

question: AWS customers receive “production system down” support within one hour when they subscribe to which support plan(s)?
AWS customers get full access to the AWS Trusted Advisor best practice checks when they subscribe to which support plan(s)?
The AWS Shared Responsibility Model illustrates how AWS itself (as opposed to its customers) is responsible for which aspects of the cloud environment?
answer: The underlying integrity and security of AWS physical resources

question: Which is a designation for two or more AWS data centers within a single geographic area?
How, using security best practices, should your organization’s team members access your AWS account resources?
answer: Through the use of specially created users, groups, and roles, each given the fewest permissions necessary

question: Which describes a methodology that protects your organization’s data when it’s on-site locally, in transit to AWS, and stored on AWS?
What authentication method will you use to access your AWS resources remotely through the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI)?
Which is the primary benefit from using resource tags with your AWS assets?
answer: Tags make it easier to identify and administrate running resources in a busy AWS account

question: What defines the base operating system and software stack that will be available for a new Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance when it launches?
answer: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) you select

question: Which AWS compute service offers an administration experience that most closely resembles the way you would run physical servers in your own local data center?
Which AWS object storage service offers the lowest ongoing charges, but at the cost of some convenience?
Which AWS storage service can make the most practical sense for petabyte-sized archives that currently exist in your local data center?
answer: Saving to an AWS Snowball device

question: Which will provide the most reliable and scalable relational database experience on AWS?
What’s the best and simplest way to increase reliability of an RDS database instance?
How does AWS describe an isolated networking environment into which you can launch compute resources while closely controlling network access?
What service does AWS use to provide a content delivery network (CDN) for its customers?
What is Amazon’s Git-compliant version control service for integrating your source code with AWS resources?
Which AWS service allows you to build a script-like template representing complex resource stacks that can be used to launch precisely defined environments involving the full range of AWS resources?
What is Amazon Athena?
answer: A service that permits queries against data stored in Amazon S3

question: What is Amazon Kinesis?
answer: A service that permits processing and analyzing of real-time

question: What is Amazon Cognito?
answer: A service that can manage authentication and authorization for your public-facing applications
